posts.cooked:
Hi. We’ve been having problems with our CANCoders not responding from our swerve modules. Does anyone know what the solution would be? I’ve updated the firmware on the CANCoders but it hasn’t fixed the issue. Phoenix Tuner: Screenshot 2023-11-28 134816 1604×516 174 KB Driverstation:

Screenshot 2023-11-28 134816 1604×516 174 KB

Screenshot 2023-11-28 134816 1604×516 174 KB

Screenshot 2023-11-28 135142 1287×300 107 KB

Screenshot 2023-11-28 135142 1287×300 107 KB

Screenshot 2023-11-28 135142 1287×300 107 KB

Code (self.angle_encoder is the CANCoder): image 920×356 20.7 KB

image 920×356 20.7 KB

image 920×356 20.7 KB

Any help is appreciated. Thanks!

posts.name: Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
Edit: see the corrections below

All of your devices need updating to the same version and your vendor libraries installed in your IDE need to be the same version. You have version 22 motor controllers but version 24 encoders and I can’t tell what version of robot code. Get all versions of firmware to the same number (24 is in beta, 23 was last season).

This is all the firmware

https://github.com/CrossTheRoadElec/Phoenix-Releases/blob/master/ctr-device-firmware.zip?raw=true

This is the latest maven repo link in CTRE docs for Phoenix 5 (last years non-pro library which is Version 23)

https://maven.ctr-electronics.com/release/com/ctre/phoenix/Phoenix5-frc2023-latest.json

posts.name: Andy Gasser
Mr. Siefen | 453
posts.cooked:
You are correct, I was going by the version number and looking at the first few devices. Looking specifically at the TalonFX you nailed it. The rest of the firmware info beyond the version number says if it’s pro, Phoenix 6 or what season it’s for. Unless you know of a specific reason you need to be using the beta 2024 (maybe prepping for it in advance for this season) you should probably use whatever was available at the end of 2023 season until the new version is fully released

Screenshot_20231128_125023_Cx File Explorer 1080×765 81.8 KB

Screenshot_20231128_125023_Cx File Explorer 1080×765 81.8 KB

Screenshot_20231128_125023_Cx File Explorer 1080×765 81.8 KB

posts.name: Dalton Smith
posts.cooked:
I just wanted to pop in and say Tuner X makes things a lot easier to keep your devices up-to-date + a few other nice features.

You shouldn’t have to manually touch a firmware file. You just select what year you want to update to and “viola”

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked: In Phoenix Tuner it looks like your CANcoders are on the RIO CAN bus, but in the code you’re saying they’re on a CANivore CAN bus. Did you rewire your robot between these two screenshots?
You’re right about me using Phoenix 5. I didn’t know the latest version of it was 22.1.1.0. Changing it fixed the issue. Thank you!

suggested_topics.title: NEO Motors not inverting
suggested_topics.excerpt: You have to set inverted within follow when using follow. So it would be config.follow(Id, true); The other inverted has no effect when using follow.
